bow: what do you feed your toddler for breakfast hey all have 15 month old increasingly picky eater and do know what to give her for breakfast or any meal at this point think part of the problem also is that she only has teeth she wo eat any sort of breads oatmeal eggs or almost any breakfast food really little sick of giving her dry cheerios and banana for breakfast and worry she not getting enough diversity in her diet meals are getting tougher and tougher and this one especially is bad she ate variety of baby foods with veg and fruit and anything we threw at her now that she eating solid foods its fight every time tia my 23 month old daughter eats everything the girl asks for eggs and waffles every morning but here are some things you have mentioned trying waffles with peanut butter and fruit yogurt usually top it with cereal and berries for her crepes fill my daughter with peanut butter and fruit smoothies non breakfast foods grilled cheese sandwiches etc it only really common to have cereal eggs etc for breakfast in the western hemisphere many cultures have soup meat noodles rice etc so maybe give those try yogurt is good option would also try grits or cream of wheat if you have yet my daughter refused oatmeal but will eat the mess out of grits with cheese found out she has issues with the textures of foods fruit salad is good option too give my little one that with bit of yogurt for breakfast and it makes her happy other than that not sure what to offer thanks we have tried either of those yet thanks have waffle maker coming from amazon today and keep trying to get her to get sandwiches but she just tears them apart grilled cheese is great idea though tearing apart sandwiches is fine actually asked this in another mom subreddit my daughter still takes apart sandwiches to eat them and the consensus is that most kids do understand how to properly eat sandwich until they re like so do discount sandwiches just because she takes them apart as long as it eaten personally do care how my daughter will lick cream cheese off of bagel then eat the bagel she weird but whatever my kid eats like four course breakfast everyday seriously it like he frontloads his day worth of calories so he can burn them off throughout the day peanut butter and jelly is popular choice at our house as well as smoothies waffles are awesome too and you can top them with peanut butter as another commenter said frozen pancakes have been hit lately as well makes life so much easier than making pancakes every morning pancakes french toast eggs yogurt mixed with granola or dried oats and cranberries avocado cream of wheat toast with peanut butter whatever make always try to do protein with it both of my boys did like eggs at first but kept making it even tho they never touched it eventually they started eating them hope this helps lol made her peanut butter and jelly and he took it apart and then basically ate it inside out was like that the opposite frozen pancakes are great idea made her pancakes couple times which she liked but there no way doing that every morning thanks she only eaten eggs once when she saw me eating them every time make them for her she throws them directly on the floor yup the dog gets his share of protein too was making pancakes nearly every day while back you get really good at it and it only takes about 15 minutes my lo loves scrambled eggs with little cheese on it and usually give him fruit of some kind like bananas strawberry or watermelon he also likes waffles or hashbrown patties like to microwave them on both sides with splash of water to keep them soft because if you toast them feel like it makes them too crispy our breakfast staples for our year old are frozen waffles pb amp toast bananas scrambled eggs sometimes with cheese cereal with tiny bit of milk poured over it frozen pancakes and frozen french toast on weekends might actually make homemade pancakes or french toast but the frozen versions are really great for quick weekday breakfasts they re also nice because you can just toast them until they re warm and they will be soft enough for kiddos without many teeth and ok our 16 month old usually will have waffle and banana or strawberries and or yogurt maybe over few hours he has breakfast at home then again really at daycare hours later recently he has been eating cereal put just enough milk in the bowl to soften them bit he uses one of those spoons with the little reservoir at the back to help catch the milk near the end he usually switches to his hands he was thrilled with the first few plain cereal choices we tried he has been loving berry cheerios on the weekends when we make ourselves breakfast he has scrambled eggs or an omelette sometimes with breakfast sausage there brand of breakfast sausage that has apples and little maple flavor that he really likes we have also pre made broccoli cheese egg muffins which were hit we seem to rotate between cottage cheese cereal drink the milk out of the bowl before give it to her scrambled eggs although pregnant now and eggs were strong food aversion and toast spears with either hummus or peanut butter we always give her fruit to go along with it my daughter is the least picky eater though she eat whatever we offered that just what easiest for us teeth should be holding her back my daughter did have any teeth until 14 months and we switched to full solids at year old the only thing she added to her diet since is apple and there are tons of stories of kids who refused everything but mac amp cheese and chicken tenders and grew up fine keep offering her different food but dry cereal and banana is totally reasonable my husband makes awesome pancakes from scratch every once in while we put the leftovers in ziploc style bags or per bag and just pull them out of the freezer to thaw in the fridge or microwave one for about 30 seconds my daughter can eat them on the way to daycare or whatever that way we get the stony field yo baby tot kids yogurt and she also loves maple cream of wheat sounds about right haha my daughter used to pull the center off of the top piece of bread and use her fingers to eat the peanut butter then she started tearing the whole thong apart and rolling peanut butter bread into little balls have been drinking soy based protein shake as my breakfast for years my toddler is crazy about it it powdered so mix it with whole milk and he sucks it down it an easy way to get him some decent nutrition especially if not awake enough to put together anything decent from there ll give him some dry cereal and fruit to snack on and that usually holds him over until after nap time we buy quiche from the grocery store every week other than that we ll do various toasts hummus toast avocado toast regular jelly toast with fruit or just mini blueberry muffins we try to get protein with every meal but if he will only eat carbs we give him milk so this might be weird but its huge hit with my now and year old boys scrambled eggs topped with grape jelly was making them eggs and toast one day and the jelly missed the bread was like uh eat around it he mixed it in and ate the whole thing my husband thinks its weird but if it keeps them eating do care when mine was that age was using frozen mini bagels as teething rings so he grew to enjoy those breakfast was usually banana applesauce oatmeal and the mini bagel then when he started refusing the applesauce mixed it in with the oatmeal that evolved into first breakfast being banana orange and bagel and second breakfast was oatmeal with some diced iqf fruit mixed in fruit defrosted and brought down the temp of the oatmeal simultaneously for the last couple of years he just done banana an orange and bagel keep in mind that breakfast does have to be designated breakfast foods there ton of fresh fruit in season now like peaches and blueberries and watermelon and you could supplement with yogurt my son first and still favorite food was mashed potatoes breakfast could really just be whatever she ll eat first thing in the morning gt and keep trying to get her to get sandwiches but she just tears them apart mine did that too still does even with grilled cheese gave up trying to get him to eat it properly and figured that as long as he eating it should complain just an fyi gums are perfectly fine for chewing most everything our kiddo will eat crackling oat bran and he 15months silver dollar pancakes frozen from trader joes french toast frozen from trader joes oatmeal muffins cereal with milk standbys that my kid likes yogurt loves it dry cereal freeze dried fruit now at 20 months he seems to like regular fruit but he used to only like freeze dried scrambled egg with some cheddar banana protein pancakes egg banana sprinkle of cinnamon and vanilla tsp of flour or oats blended and cooked like normal pancakes he also normally has baby food pouch or apple sauce my kid got really picky from 14 months to 19 months but has been eating much better over the last month or so he used to eat almost anything and then went on strike to only eat like crackers cottage cheese yogurt food pouches and beans for couple months but now he eats much better and will eat most foods that offer him especially if it comes with sauce to dip it probably phase what was doing when my son was the same age is keep his food on one section of my plate because he wanted my food his food was poison even if it was the same thing also take bite of it and then he ll want it my daughter has the same thing every morning breakfast cookies banana oats dried fruit bake at 350 for 10 15 min cool on baking sheet and smoothie yogurt in 10oz of milk its easy and covers most of the food groups that really smart never thought about freezing pancakes for later of course had this image that she would be eating all this wonderful organic fruit and veg and now totally get kids eating nothing but chicken tenders if that what she ll eat that what she getting thanks have even looked at the frozen options yet thanks several people have been saying smoothies and have tried that yet ll give it whirl it might just be her but she seems to struggle with ton of things if we do cut things up small or leave the skin on fruit she just spits it out going to trader joe today ll check out the frozen stuff thanks suspect it phase she was good eater before but until it over need this baby to eat we ll also try yogurt it one of the things we ve never tried thanks for those recipes that breakfast cookie seems like great thing to have on hand as snack too lots of great stuff there their turkey corn dogs are good as are their pot stickers and wontons ve like 90 of the foods ve tried there my kid is not yet picky but mix it up with american korean foods hashbrowns sausage bacon ham french toast pancakes fresh fruit puree or topping with no syrup cause its sweet as is cinnamon raisin bread with little jelly or peanut butter yogurt bananas with peanut butter cheddar cheese or colby jack cereal with whole milk and put fruit in and scrambled egg with cheddar cheese on top with little black pepper korean breakfast do steamed egg rice kimchi meat and seaweed wrap my brother works there so we ve tried it all and my daughter picked up one pot sticker looked at it like it was the worst thing she ever touched then set it on the table and pushed it away spoiled we have krusteaz just add water pancake mix they are really good but definitely not scratch quality my kid also ate cottage cheese every day for lunch for months so you can try that too sometimes he eat that for lunch and dinner along with those fruit veggie pouches struggle feeding my 10 month old who wo eat baby food or formula today he had some of my egg bite and diced peach he is about 75 breastfed and 25 food foodertaintment bake pancake batter in mini muffin tin and throw few pieces of fruit in there freeze and thaw as necessary easy and quick to make lots at once and they re great for the car thats great idea thanks took the wrapper off and she ate the inside you know have the time and love to cook even perfected my own pancake recipe from scratch made them from scratch for while until used krusteaz while camping thought they were only so good because we were in the woods but got home and made them again and still use krusteaz love it more than any other pancake ve made and the ease makes it so worth it have and year old and try to stick to formula for breakfasts whole grains fruit protein they both really like multi grain cheerio with little cinnamon sprinkled on top it bit messy still but the year old manages bowl of cereal with milk ok now in addition to milk for protein ll give them eggs mix in little sharp cheddar cheese and they love little pepper on them too or some whole fat yogurt with berries also do feel stuck on breakfast foods when it close to grocery day and we re running low on stuff ve been known to give my kids turkey and cheese roll ups alongside their morning serving of fruit turkey sausage is also big hit wow no teeth until 14 months my little guy is months and no sign of teeth thought that was late we re breastfeeding so be happy for him to be as late as possible on this my son has yogurt fruit normally blueberries strawberries or banana and some type of carb pancakes oatmeal muffins maybe some cheerios typically make and freeze ton of mini pancakes and oatmeal muffins at the beginning of the month that way do have to cook breakfast for oatmeal muffins just do instant oatmeal melted peanut butter and little honey since my kiddo hates oatmeal also he only eats pancakes if he can dip them in yogurt also when my son is being picky about eating good stuff make him smootie with frozen fruit frozen veggies normally kale spinach blend and yogurt he will drink it super fast and loves it plus it has all the veggies he needs and then some for the day my son is big fan of cheese quesadillas too more so than grilled cheese and he does care if it just microwaved instead of grilled just in case you do want to get out pan krusteaz is one of my go to brands their chocolate chip cookie mix actually taste like what grandma used to make not that weird chemical fake crap betty crocker puts out does your daughter help cook my son pulls chair up and helps make stir eggs or dip toast for french toast basically whatever doing he helping also make omelets frequently and load them up with veggies and cheese or quiche so you ca really taste the eggs but we get most of our veggies in the morning when my son is hungry and trick him into eating healthy food what does she enjoy eating right now to echo unicorntoots lot of the foods listed in these comments are very typical of the western american world other countries have more savory breakfasts it not like 8am food must be cereal fruit etc in arab culture breakfast is spread with samples of pita hummus olive oil cheese olives pickles in asian culture it can from noodles and soups to rice porridge was definitely little worried we were pretty close to getting dentist to take look to make sure she had teeth at all when they started emerging fortunately she been champ about it and really does seem unhappy even when she gets in the course of two weeks what do you eat for breakfast do make anything special or different for the kids unless it crunchy like carrots or nuts my toddler eats it too if she does want it then she does eat it she ll just have to wait for the next meal my older kid is very picky but she has certain things she likes and avoids others no big deal give variety and offer little of everything every time decide the what and when of the meals and kids decide how much to answer more specifically toast yogurt muffins cheese pancakes oatmeal eggs and smoothies are the things we do stick with the foods she likes just because we adults are accustomed to having certain types of foods at breakfast it does mean that little ones can only eat those things tastes change over time so feed her whatever she does like for now then keep trying to reintroduce other foods try preparing or presenting them in different ways eggs can be scrambled or poached or sunny side up banana can be whole or cut up etc let her see adults and other family members eating those foods my kids just wanted to eat whatever was eating so would plan my meal that way and eventually go to giving them their own food and saying see it the same my toddler is too hungry first thing in the morning but after having some water snuggling and helping me feed the dogs she nibbles on turkey bacon hash browns and fruit some days she refuses to eat breakfast so she gets spoonful of almond butter with her milk until shes ready to eat meal she only has teeth so still cut most things in tiny pieces ca wait to try this as other people have said it does have to be breakfast food many mornings my daughter has requested carrots and hummus was about to deny the opportunity to get some veggies into her this am it was cheese and tomatoes for my son weird but better than nothing my older toddler still does this say at least once every lunch time just eat it like normal sandwich my two and half year old is fairly picky as well but breakfast has always been little easier for us we take normal breakfast food and pair it with fruit and she will eat every bite some common breakfasts at our house are waffles with bananas yogurt with blueberries and mango oatmeal with raisins and apples scrambled eggs with sliced peaches my 19 month old loves fresh fruit my year old ate sandwich properly the other day and was so excited grilled cheese is easier than most though because it fused together with the melted cheese also make lot of cheese quesadillas around here just to mix it up could you make her smoothie even put broccoli peas spinach add some yogurt for protein and when she old enough peanut butter or almond butter also give my son sprouted toast with butter and tiny pinch of cinnamon and sugar the biggest advice have regarding this is do stop giving her the foods you think she does like so much of liking something is just its familiarity so even though she may not eat the eggs the first 20 times by the 21st time they will look so familiar that she might eat them and realize eggs are delicious my son has done this with countless foods do you have sprout in any of your stores try out their toddler snacks they are harder but not hard found those worked as good transition my kiddo wo eat skin either think that probably more of biting thing than mushing grinding action kiddo definitely still needs most food in bite sized pieces but he ll kind of take bites out of cooked carrots and potatoes fries which probably helps him start to learn that next step have you tried beans at all they have that great in between soft and hard texture my lo likes protein pancakes here dead easy recipe cup cottage cheese cup old fashioned oats eggs blend and make pancakes full of protein if you do have microwave like us in our tiny br city apartment you can easily thaw pancakes by steaming them fyi hummus and pita cottage cheese other dry cereals cinnamon life is big hit in our house refried beans and tortilla beans and rice basically whatever my kid will eat gets sometimes put in front of him at breakfast my pediatrician told us that as long as we re offering food he not going to starve himself that really good idea steaming them is super smart the best thing about food is that breakfast food doesnt have to be what for breakfast she might like bubble and squeak pancakes all sorts of root veghies mashed and then shaped into pancakes yummy and good nutrition you can try mixing in egg white to combine it and to add protien it should be noticable in the same boat and no teeth swear one was poking up couple weeks ago but it went back down haha he acts like he teething badly sometimes but nothing yet my son loves sausage cook batch and keep it in the fridge so he can have few pieces for breakfast each day he will eat the patties but if cook the ones shaped like wienes then do have to dirty fort to flip them just shake the pan around started buying frozen waffles too have tried putting peanut butter on them but that def his breakfast tomorrow he also loves berries if cook him grits add cheese and slightly over cook them so they are extra sticky then it easier for him to use his fork honestly think grits are why he is so good with his fork his ability to eat with fork so early is literally my only mom accomplishment anything breakfast if you eat it in the morning if it healthy for dinner then it healthy for breakfast just try to get some nutrition in my year old sometimes he ll eat leftover veggie stir fry from the night before or some days he difficult and wants mac and cheese lol that fine with me ll just mix half mac and cheese with half eviscerated broccoli pieces too small to pick out these are all things tend to have on hand because know he ll eat them so they re quick to throw together eat normal breakfast so sometimes he eats eggs or oatmeal or whatever but trying to find foods he likes that fit properly into cultural categories just is worth the effort imo haha does matter what make him he wo eat it even if it something he asked for try cutting all the sandwiches into tiny bite sized squares my mom did this for us and remember loving the special tiny sandwiches to me breakfast does necessarily have to be breakfast food it can be anything my little one 16mo likes to be mobile and does really like the high chair he just throws everything overboard so try to give him food that he can either walk around with that wo destroy our furniture or that can spoon feed him other than things like bagels waffles and toast which you said she does like do blueberries apples just give him the whole apple to gnaw on nectarines cottage cheese yogurt cheese chunk cucumber shelled edamame and hard boiled eggs that great idea ve been having more luck with cutting things smaller with her eggo brand chocolate and banana waffle sticks in the frozen section scrambled eggs morning star brand sausage links oatmeal whole milk yogurt baby food pouches nutrigrain cereal bars fruit have yo boy made crustless quiche hid spinach in it and he loves that for some reason might be all the bacon cream and butter does really like scrambled eggs try toast with peanut butter he usually licks off the butter few bites of the bread sandwiches are fave with turkey lunch meat and mayo grilled cheese too guess he savory fan yogurt but try not to give him those too much because of all the sugar they put in the fruit ones he recently started liking cherries tho he always says he does want them when they re on his plate but by the end of breakfast they re all gone just keep trying did this until was about 10 liked to pick them apart totally normal that fun idea in europe when visit family it was always bread cheese amp tomatoes and occasional cucumber salad if they were available lot of people keep suggesting smoothies and never even thought to try it will do and constantly eating eggs in front of her hopefully that will help thank you that interesting wonder if she just not morning eater and she only has teeth sure that makes difference she big helper in the kitchen and sometimes it the only way to get her to eat if put piece of toast in the toaster give her piece of bread to nibble on ve never made her quiche but ll try it sometimes make breakfast popsicles coconut milk or yogurt blended with fruit and bit of maple syrup it does include grain but on hot mornings it way to get something in my kids it also nice not too sugary sweet any other time of day love jelly on eggs put some on her plate too the rule in our house is you do have to eat it but you have to have it on your plate
